meanings.definition: Of or relating to a quadrilateral.
meanings.sent1: The quadric shape of the playground made it easy to divide into four equal sections.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained that a quadric figure has four sides.
meanings.sent3: The quadric pattern on the floor tiles created an interesting optical illusion.
meanings.sent4: Her quadric approach to organizing her desk helped her keep everything in order.
meanings.sent5: The quadric design of the building's layout was both functional and visually appealing.

meanings.definition: A surface of the second degree in a space of three dimensions.
meanings.sent1: The artist used a quadric to represent a curved surface in the sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician studied the properties of quadrics in geometry class.
meanings.sent3: The quadric in the art exhibit seemed to defy gravity with its shape.
meanings.sent4: The quadric of the hillside resembled a gentle slope, perfect for hiking.
meanings.sent5: The quadric of the mirror reflected the room in a distorted manner.
